conclusion: Apply the first law of thermodynamics to determine heat transferred.
A to B is an isochoric process; B to C is an isobaric process.
Work done from A to B is 0 because volume does not change.
Calculate work done from B to C using W = PΔV.
Change in internal energy for ideal gas depends on temperature change.
Use ideal gas law to find temperature at state C.
Temperature at state C is 300 K, same as state A, so ΔT = 0.
Calculate heat transferred using ΔU = Q - W.
